WorkItem.ClosedComment:
Hi,

It could be helpful to know that, as of Prism v2 the line you're mentioning has been changed to this:

PublishedDate = DateTime.Parse(x.Attribute("PublishedDate").Value, CultureInfo.InvariantCulture)

This change is also visible in Prism v4, where the aforementioned line is present.

Thank you for your feedback.

Guido Leandro Maliandi
http://blogs.southworks.net/gmaliandi
WorkItem.Description:
I'm running StockTraderRI on my machine (with italian culture settings) and this line fails 
PublishedDate = DateTime.Parse(newsItem.Attribute("PublishedDate").Value, CultureInfo.CurrentCulture)
cause date can be parse correctly. I fix with this line
PublishedDate = DateTime.Parse(newsItem.Attribute("PublishedDate").Value, CultureInfo.GetCultureInfo("en-us"))
Â 
Bye
m.

Comments.Message:
Experiencing the same problem with the French culture settings. I would argue that the impact of this issue is quite high as people with "exotic" culture settings are not even able to run the application.
A fix proposed by makka might be even more generic:
PublishedDate = DateTime.Parse(newsItem.Attribute("PublishedDate").Value, CultureInfo.InvariantCulture)
Thanks - i have tracked both those issue and will work to resolve them.  Thanks Larry
